meanings.definition: The act of making something symmetrical.
meanings.sent1: The symmetrization of the butterfly wings made them look identical on both sides.
meanings.sent2: The artist used symmetrization to ensure both sides of the painting were perfectly balanced.
meanings.sent3: During the symmetrization of the cake, the baker accidentally added too much frosting on one side.
meanings.sent4: The symmetrization of the garden created a sense of harmony and balance throughout the space.
meanings.sent5: The symmetrization of the room's decor gave it a pleasing and uniform appearance.

meanings.definition: The process of creating symmetry in an object or system.
meanings.sent1: Through careful symmetrization, the architect designed a building with perfect balance.
meanings.sent2: The symmetrization of the circuit board ensured optimal performance.
meanings.sent3: The symmetrization of the traffic flow in the city made commuting much smoother.
meanings.sent4: The symmetrization of the team's strategies led to a more cohesive and effective approach.
meanings.sent5: The symmetrization of the music arrangement added depth and richness to the composition.
